gcci.text: As H100 rental rates settle near $3.16/hr, the shift to H200 is concentrating H100 into larger, lower-cost clusters while supply tightens on advanced nodes, compressing margins and extending capex payback for hyperscalers.

gtpi.text: At an average input price around $1.25 per million tokens, the token market remains fiercely competitive; providers are racing to compress costs through smaller MoE models and longer context windows, pushing efficiency to the fore.

gagl.text: AI’s estimated 120 TWh annual load is magnifying grid strain and accelerating nuclear and long-duration storage interest to mitigate emissions and stabilize baseload in data-heavy regions.

aipi.text: While sentiment remains bullish, the AI wave now confronts structural friction from energy constraints and chip availability, making growth sustainability the key watchpoint for capex-heavy players.
